reviews.text: This hotel was disappointing mainly because of the poor location, which is not even in Cesme proper but in Dalyan, which feels like surburban town. There is a marina nearby that is mostly fenced in with a high gate and barbed wire. I have no idea how the Tripadvisor ratings are so high. The facilities themselves are fine - clean albeit outdated furnishings. It's as if they bought all the 'modern' furnishings off Overstock.com or something. Room is a good size with two big closets. There is a balcony overlooking the houses nearby. The rooms on one side of the hotel are overlooking construction. The hotel pool is nice and big. Food is fine. Not much variety in the buffets but sufficiently fresh.
reviews.title: Decent facilities, but nowhere near the beach.

reviews.text: The biggest problem is the location. There's nothing nice nearby and the beach is a bus ride away. The hotel offers shuttle service but only once an hour starting at 11am. This is a huge disappointment. Who comes to Cesme to stare at surburban-looking houses and a fenced-in marina?! I would check out but unfortunately we did some prepaid plan and can't get a refund.
reviews.title: Comfortable&Friendly Hotel

reviews.text: This is the second time I stayed this hotel. Nice and clean hotel with friendly staff. The best advantage of the hotel is that it provides free entrance to the famous beached in Aya Yorgi and provides transportation to that area.We dıd not use the pool but it seems clean and nice if you prefer.Both the breakfast and dinner was good and delicious. Hotel locates near the Dalyan marine. There are a lot of fish restaurants nearby that you may prefer to have a dinner with rakı & balık in a peaceful place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sisus Hotel is located in Dalyan village in Cesme. It's 5 minutes away drive from the towncenter. Dalyan is a quiet nice place. There's a marina and many fish restaurants. Oh and also you must taste the mastica flavored ice cream at Veli Usta! It's delicious :)
reviews.title: Very quality hotel- we loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to the hotel.. The hotel has a very modern interior design, the rooms are spacious and comfortable. The bathroom in the room was very chic. Pool area is kind of small though. The pool is nice enough, you can swim comfortably but there aren't many sunbeds and the ones they have aren't comfortable, like rocking chairs. there's a grass area around the pool which isn't being used effectively. They need to put cushions and sutff there to have a more trendy look and it'll be more comfortable that way.
reviews.title: Chic and restful

reviews.text: There's a shuttle service at the every hour, they provide free entrance to two beach clubs- Cafe Pi and Babylon. I highly recommend Babylon. Oh these beach clubs are located on Hagia Yorgi Bay. The sea is fantastic. It's cold but lovely. Very nice turqoise water with sand ground. Babylon bech club food service is expensive but very quality food and service. It's worth the money you spend. We didn't like cafe pi as it was side by side sun beds and the music wasn't appealing. Babylon is a more classy place. But at the end of the day, they are all on the same bay, so you're in the same sea :) so it doesn't matter where you go :)
